summary: A letter from defense attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim to Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's case, informing the court about a new interview with Juror 50 scheduled to air on Paramount Plus and requesting a stay of the court's ruling pending review of the interview.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell who writes the letter to Judge Nathan, informing about new information concerning Juror 50 and requesting a stay of the court's ruling.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell case, to whom the letter is addressed.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case (S2 20 Cr. 330), whose attorney is filing this letter regarding a motion for a new trial related to Juror 50.

persons.name: Juror 50
persons.context: A juror in Ghislaine Maxwell's trial who gave an interview for a Paramount Plus series, which may impact Maxwell's motion for a new trial. He previously testified at a hearing on March 8.

connections.description: Sternheim is the defense attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell in the criminal case, as indicated by the letterhead and content.
Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.
Juror 50 served on the jury in Ghislaine Maxwell's trial, and his conduct/interviews are central to her motion for a new trial.

events.title: Juror 50 Hearing Testimony
events.description: Juror 50 testified at a hearing regarding his conduct during Ghislaine Maxwell's trial.

events.title: Scheduled Air Date for Paramount Plus Series
events.description: Paramount Plus was scheduled to air an interview with Juror 50 in the series "Ghislaine — Partner in Crime," but held off pending the court's ruling.

events.title: Defense Letter to Court
events.description: Defense attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim writes to Judge Nathan about a new interview with Juror 50 and requests a stay of the ruling on Maxwell's motion for a new trial.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Defense attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim informs the court about a new interview with Juror 50 scheduled for a Paramount Plus series titled "Ghislaine — Partner in Crime."
The interview reportedly contains a "bombshell revelation" from Juror 50, but it is unclear if it was recorded before his March 8 hearing testimony.
Paramount Plus held off airing the series pending the court's ruling concerning Juror 50.
The defense requests a stay of any ruling on Ghislaine Maxwell's motion for a new trial until the court and counsel can review the interview.
